classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as alkyl nitrates. These are organic compounds containing a nitrate that is O-linked to an alkyl group.

drug-interaction.name: Dapoxetine
drug-interaction.description: Dapoxetine may increase the orthostatic hypotensive and hypotensive activities of Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Riociguat
drug-interaction.description: Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate may increase the hypotensive activities of Riociguat.

drug-interaction.name: Rosiglitazone
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate is combined with Rosiglitazone.

drug-interaction.name: Molsidomine
drug-interaction.description: Molsidomine may increase the hypotensive activities of Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Milrinone
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Milrinone is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Anagrelide
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Anagrelide is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Theophylline
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Theophylline is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Pentoxifylline
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Pentoxifylline is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Tadalafil
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Tadalafil is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Vardenafil
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Vardenafil is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Dipyridamole
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Dipyridamole is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Ibudilast
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Ibudilast is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Avanafil
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Avanafil is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Udenafil
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Udenafil is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Doxofylline
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Doxofylline is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Mirodenafil
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Mirodenafil is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Fostamatinib
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Fostamatinib is combined with Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Ethanol
drug-interaction.description: Ethanol may increase the hypotensive and vasodilatory activities of Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate.

drug-interaction.name: Patent Blue
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate can be decreased when used in combination with Patent Blue.

drug-interaction.name: Sildenafil
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Methylpropylpropanediol dinitrate is combined with Sildenafil.
